primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enacts a plan of salvation to preserve humanity and creation from the total destruction necessitated by universal sin, culminating in an unconditional covenant.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is already preparing his plan of salvation.
God performs an unambiguous act of divine grace.

object.identificatie: The preservation and redemption of the human race and creation.
tekstueel_bewijs: preserving Noah and the earth’s creatures
God’s mighty plan to redeem the earth
God’s own righteous wrath at sin

ontvanger.identificatie: Noah, his descendants, and every living creature.
tekstueel_bewijs: between me and you and every living creature
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the passive Receiver of the covenant/protection.

helper.identificatie: Noah (as agent) and the Ark (as instrument).
tekstueel_bewijs: Noah’s innate righteousness... is derived from God’s favor
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External providence and 'favor' (grace) acting upon the agent.

tegenstander.identificatie: Universal Sin and the 'Evil Imagination' of the heart.
tekstueel_bewijs: every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an ontological contamination that justifies total extinction; it is not a 'mistake' but a state of captivity.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's shift in perspective to see the world and sin as God sees it during Lent.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christian Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's 'seeing' (Secondary) is a response to God's 'acting' (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is already preparing his plan of salvation.
God has picked him out from his birth.
God performs an unambiguous act of divine grace.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Noah does not utter a single word.
We tend to look at things from our own very constricted point of view.

voorbeelden: we should become like the Biblical writers
The Bible demands that we see the bigger picture.
God was sorry that he had made man
it grieved him to his heart
learned to see sin as God sees it
understand and to grasp by faith
any righteousness... is derived from God’s favor rather than any capacity of our own
guarantee of protection against the effects of our own rapacity

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) and God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power) to save despite human failure.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (God's right to wipe out humanity), moves to ~S1 (human corruption), and resolves in S1 (unconditional covenant) via ~S2 (God's promise not to destroy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's unilateral decision to 'remember' the covenant despite the persistence of S2 (evil imagination).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon insists God has the 'right' to destroy the race.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. God is the primary actor; Noah is a passive recipient/agent; grace is unconditional and precedes human response.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible demands that we see the bigger picture.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is already preparing his plan of salvation.
He reveals that his covenant with Noah and his descendants is unconditional.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Noah is explicitly de-emphasized as a moral hero.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Noah (specifically rejected as a model of innate righteousness)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Noah is an 'agent' of God's favor, not a hero to be imitated.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; a shift from self-justification to reliance on God's promise.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; the hearer is 'saved through water' rather than by effort.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Flood to the Cross is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The paradox that God saves even though 'the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The rainbow bridge leads to the Cross... because of that and nothing else.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father's decree and the Son's work than the Spirit's indwelling.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon perfectly maintains God as the Subject. Noah is correctly positioned as a functional actant (Helper/Receiver) rather than a moral Subject.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'seeing' not just to a Lenten discipline but to the Spirit's opening of eyes.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God saves) → Ethics (We see the world differently).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It successfully resists the 'children's story' trivialization by taking the Opponent (Sin) and the Subject (God) with absolute structural seriousness.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'ant/elephant' metaphor; Greimas shows this metaphor functions to shift the Actantial Subject from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew context; Greimas reveals how the sermon's 'engine' is driven by God's unilateral action.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that Noah's 'silence' is not just a narrative detail but a structural necessity to keep God as the sole Subject.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (prepares, selects, shuts, smells, says, reveals, makes, remembers)
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' almost perfectly.
